page.title: 04FARMING IN MAWNAN
page.content: Out of the{13 farms}in Mawnan 2 are owned by the National Trust and 2 by the County Council.3 of the farmers own extensive amounts of land elsewhere.10 out of them are well established family farms.4 of them work the farms by themselves.We interviewed 3 of the farmers the rest were too busy haymaking.They had 800 anmimals and 870 acres of land between them.They had grassland for silage, barley, wheat, peas, potatoes, dairy cows and beef animals.Some of them believe in knocking down hedges to make the fields bigger for the machines.They all use{pesticides}and sprays.They all own a lot of machinery.To be a good farmer they said you need patience, dedication, tenacity, strength and a 24 hour care for animals.
